claim_text: This Regulation protects fundamental rights and freedoms of natural persons.
source_quote: 2. This Regulation protects fundamental rights and freedoms of natural persons and in particular their right to the protection of personal data.

claim_text: The free movement of personal data within the Union shall not be restricted or prohibited for reasons connected with the processing of personal data.
source_quote: 3. The free movement of personal data within the Union shall be neither restricted nor prohibited for reasons connected with the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data.

claim_text: This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data wholly or partly by automated means and to the processing other than by automated means of personal data which form part of a filing system or are intended to form part of a filing system.
source_quote: 1. This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data: (a) in the course of an activity which falls outside the scope of Union law; (b) by the Member States when carrying out activities which fall within the scope of Chapter 2 of Title V of the TEU; (c) by a natural person in the course of a purely personal or household activity; (d) by competent authorities for the purposes of the prevention, investigation, detection or prosecution of criminal offences or the execution of criminal penalties, including the safeguarding against and the prevention of threats to public security.

claim_text: This Regulation does not apply to the processing of personal data in the course of an activity which falls outside the scope of Union law.
source_quote: 2. This Regulation does not apply to the processing of personal data: (a) in the course of an activity which falls outside the scope of Union law; (b) by the Member States when carrying out activities which fall within the scope of Chapter 2 of Title V of the TEU; (c) by a natural person in the course of a purely personal or household activity; (d) by competent authorities for the purposes of the prevention, investigation, detection or prosecution of criminal offences or the execution of criminal penalties, including the safeguarding against and the prevention of threats to public security.

claim_text: This Regulation does not apply to the processing of personal data by the Member States when carrying out activities which fall within the scope of Chapter 2 of Title V of the TEU.

claim_text: This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data in the context of an establishment of a controller or processor in the Union.
source_quote: 1. This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data in the context of the activities of an establishment of a controller or a processor in the Union, regardless of whether the processing takes place in the Union or not.

claim_text: This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data of data subjects who are in the EU by a controller or processor not established in the EU.
source_quote: 2. This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data of data subjects who are in the Union by a controller or processor not established in the Union, where the processing activities are related to: (a) the offering of goods or services, irrespective of whether a payment of the data subject is required, to such data subjects in the Union; or (b) the monitoring of their behaviour as far as their behaviour takes place within the Union.

claim_text: This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data by a controller not established in the EU, but in a place where Member State law applies.
source_quote: 3. This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data by a controller not established in the Union, but in a place where Member State law applies by virtue of public

claim_text: The Regulation applies to the processing of personal data by a controller not established in the Union.
source_quote: This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data by a controller not established in the Union, but in a place where Member State law applies by virtue of public international law.

claim_text: The Regulation covers situations where a controller or processor is established within the EU.
source_quote: It covers situations where a controller or processor is established within the EU,

claim_text: The Regulation applies to scenarios where a non-EU-based controller processes data subjects' information if they are in the EU.
source_quote: Additionally, it includes scenarios where a non-EU-based controller processes data subjects' information if they are in the EU

claim_text: Profiling refers to any form of automated processing of personal data.
source_quote: 'profiling' means any form of automated processing of personal data

claim_text: Pseudonymisation is the processing of personal data in a way that cannot be attributed to a specific individual without additional information.
source_quote: 'pseudonymisation' means the processing of personal data in such a manner that the personal data can no longer be attributed to a specific data subject

claim_text: A filing system is any structured set of personal data accessible according to specific criteria.
source_quote: 'filing system' means any structured set of personal data which are accessible according to specific criteria

claim_text: The controller determines the purposes and means of processing personal data.
source_quote: 'controller' means the natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which, alone or jointly with others, determines the purposes and means of the processing of personal data

claim_text: A processor processes personal data on behalf of a controller.
source_quote: 'processor' means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which processes personal data on behalf of the controller

claim_text: The controller or specific criteria for its nomination may be provided by Union or Member State law.
source_quote: the controller or the specific criteria for its nomination may be provided for by Union or Member State law;

claim_text: A processor is a natural or legal person that processes personal data on behalf of a controller.
source_quote: 'processor' means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which processes personal data on behalf of the controller;

claim_text: A recipient includes public authorities receiving personal data for specific inquiries and third parties authorized to process data under the controller's direct authority.
source_quote: 'recipient' means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency or another body, to which the personal data are disclosed, whether a third party or not. However, public authorities which may receive personal data in the framework of a particular inquiry in accordance with Union or Member State law shall not be regarded as recipients;

claim_text: Consent means any freely given, specific, informed and unambiguous indication of a data subject's wishes by which they signify agreement to processing their personal data.
source_quote: 'consent' of the data subject means any freely given, specific, informed and unambiguous indication of the data subject's wishes by which he or she, by a statement or by a clear affirmative action, signifies agreement to the processing of personal data relating to him or her;

claim_text: A personal data breach is a breach of security leading to the accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorized disclosure of, or access to, personal data.
source_quote: 'personal data breach' means a breach of security leading to the accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorised disclosure of, or access to, personal data transmitted, stored or otherwise processed

claim_text: A 'personal data breach' refers to a breach of security leading to accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorized disclosure of, or access to personal data.
source_quote: 'personal data breach' means a breach of security leading to the accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorised disclosure of, or access to, personal data

claim_text: Genetic data refers to personal data relating to inherited or acquired genetic characteristics that give unique information about physiology or health.
source_quote: 'genetic data' means personal data relating to the inherited or acquired genetic characteristics of a natural person which give unique information about the physiology or the health of that natural person

claim_text: Biometric data refers to personal data resulting from specific technical processing related to physical, physiological, or behavioral characteristics that allow or confirm unique identification.
source_quote: 'biometric data' means personal data resulting from specific technical processing relating to the physical, physiological or behavioural characteristics of a natural person, which allow or confirm the unique identification of that natural person

claim_text: Data concerning health refers to personal data related to physical or mental health that reveals information about an individual's health status.
source_quote: 'data concerning health' means personal data related to the physical or mental health of a natural person, including the provision of health care services, which reveal information about his or her health status

claim_text: The 'main establishment' refers to the place where decisions on purposes and means of processing are taken for a controller with multiple establishments in the EU.
source_quote: (a) as regards a controller with establishments in more than one Member State, the place of its central administration in the Union, unless the decisions on the purposes and means of the processing of personal data are taken in another establishment of the controller in the Union

claim_text: A controller or processor with multiple establishments in the EU has a 'main establishment'.
source_quote: the latter establishment has the power to have such decisions implemented, in which case the establishment having taken such decisions is to be considered to be the main establishment;

claim_text: The 'representative' of a controller or processor is designated by the controller or processor in writing.
source_quote: 'representative' means a natural or legal person established in the Union who, designated by the controller or processor in writing pursuant to Article 27,

claim_text: An 'enterprise' is a natural or legal person engaged in an economic activity.
source_quote: 'enterprise' means a natural or legal person engaged in an economic activity, irrespective of its legal form, including partnerships or associations regularly engaged in an economic activity;

claim_text: A 'group of undertakings' is a controlling undertaking and its controlled undertakings.
source_quote: 'group of undertakings' means a controlling undertaking and its controlled undertakings;

claim_text: A 'controller' can be established on the territory of a Member State.
source_quote: 'controller or processor established on the territory of a Member State

claim_text: A 'processor' can be established on the territory of a Member State.
source_quote: 'controller or processor established on the territory of a Member State'

claim_text: A supervisory authority is an independent public authority established by a Member State.
source_quote: 'supervisory authority' means an independent public authority which is established by a Member State

claim_text: A supervisory authority concerned is one that is affected by the processing due to its territorial location, impact on local data subjects, or a complaint lodged with it.
source_quote: 'supervisory authority concerned' means a supervisory authority which is concerned by the processing of personal data because: (a) ...; (b) ...; or (c) ...

claim_text: Cross-border processing refers to situations where personal data processing affects or is likely to affect data subjects in more than one Member State.
source_quote: 'cross-border processing' means either: (a) ...; or (b) ...;

claim_text: Personal data shall be processed lawfully.
source_quote: Personal data shall be: (a) processed lawfully,

claim_text: Personal data shall be processed fairly.
source_quote: Personal data shall be: (a) processed lawfully, fairly

claim_text: Personal data shall be processed in a transparent manner.
source_quote: Personal data shall be: (a) processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner

claim_text: Personal data shall be collected for specified purposes.
source_quote: collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes

claim_text: Further processing of personal data is not allowed if it is incompatible with the original purpose.
source_quote: further processed in a manner that is incompatible with those purposes

claim_text: Personal data must not be further processed in a manner that is incompatible with its initial purposes.
source_quote: further processing for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes shall, in accordance with Article 89(1), not be considered to be incompatible with the initial purposes ('purpose limitation');

claim_text: Data minimisation requires that personal data be adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to its purposes.
source_quote: (c) adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed ('data minimisation');

claim_text: Personal data must be accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date.
source_quote: (d) accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date;

claim_text: Inaccurate personal data must be erased or rectified without delay.
source_quote: 'accuracy'; (every reasonable step must be taken to ensure that personal data that are inaccurate, having regard to the purposes for which they are processed, are erased or rectified without delay)

claim_text: Personal data may only be stored for as long as necessary for its intended purposes.
source_quote: kept in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which the personal data are processed;

claim_text: Personal data must be processed to ensure appropriate security, including protection against unauthorized or unlawful processing and accidental loss, destruction, or damage.
source_quote: 'integrity and confidentiality', using appropriate technical or organisational measures

claim_text: Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies.
source_quote: Article 6 Lawfulness of processing 1. Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies:

claim_text: The data subject has given consent to the processing of his or her personal data for one or more specific purposes.
source_quote: (a) the data subject has given consent to the processing of his or her personal data for one or more specific purposes;

claim_text: Processing is necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is party or in order to take steps at the request of the data subject prior to entering into a contract.
source_quote: (b) processing is necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is party or in order to take steps at the request of the data subject prior to entering into a contract;

claim_text: Processing is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation to which the controller is subject.
source_quote: (c) processing is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation to which the controller is subject;

claim_text: Processing is necessary in order to protect the vital interests of the data subject or of another natural person.
source_quote: (d) processing is necessary in order to protect the vital interests of the data subject or of another natural person;

claim_text: Processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller.
source_quote: (e) processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller;

claim_text: Processing is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the controller or by a third party, except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject which require protection of personal data.
source_quote: (f) processing is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the controller or by a third party, except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject which require protection of personal data,

claim_text: The Regulation's purposes are overridden by the data subject's fundamental rights and freedoms when personal data requires protection.
source_quote: except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject which require protection

claim_text: Point (f) of the first subparagraph does not apply to processing carried out by public authorities in the performance of their tasks.
source_quote: Point (f) of the first subparagraph shall not apply to processing carried out by public authorities in the performance of their tasks

claim_text: Member States may maintain or introduce more specific provisions to adapt the application of the Regulation's rules for certain processing situations.
source_quote: Member States may maintain or introduce more specific provisions to adapt the application of the rules of this Regulation with regard to processing for compliance with points (c) and (e) of paragraph 1

claim_text: The basis for processing under points (c) and (e) of paragraph 1 shall be laid down by Union law or Member State law.
source_quote: The basis for the processing referred to in point (c) and (e) of paragraph 1 shall be laid down by: (a) Union law; or (b) Member State law to which the controller is subject

claim_text: The purpose of processing under points (c) and (e) of paragraph 1 must be determined in the legal basis.
source_quote: The purpose of the processing shall be determined in that legal basis or, as regards the processing referred to in point (e) of paragraph 1, shall be necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller

claim_text: The legal basis for processing personal data may contain specific provisions to adapt the application of GDPR rules.
source_quote: the controller. That legal basis may contain specific provisions to adapt the application of rules of this Regulation

claim_text: The general conditions governing the lawfulness of processing by the controller must be considered.
source_quote: the general conditions governing the lawfulness of processing by the controller

claim_text: Types of data subject to processing and data subjects concerned must be specified.
source_quote: the types of data which are subject to the processing; the data subjects concerned

claim_text: Entities to which personal data may be disclosed and purposes for disclosure must be defined.
source_quote: the entities to, and the purposes for which, the personal data may be disclosed

claim_text: Purpose limitation is a requirement for lawful processing.
source_quote: the purpose limitation

claim_text: Storage periods must be established for processed data.
source_quote: storage periods

claim_text: Processing procedures, including measures to ensure lawful and fair processing, are necessary.
source_quote: processing operations and processing procedures, including measures to ensure lawful and fair processing

claim_text: Union or Member State law must meet an objective of public interest and be proportionate to the legitimate aim pursued.
source_quote: The Union or the Member State law shall meet an objective of public interest and be proportionate to the legitimate aim pursued

claim_text: Processing for a purpose other than initial collection requires consent or a necessary and proportionate measure in a democratic society.
source_quote: Where the processing for a purpose other than that for which the personal data have been collected is not based on the data subject's consent or on a Union or Member State law which constitutes a necessary and proportionate measure in a democratic society

claim_text: The controller must consider factors when determining whether further processing is compatible with initial collection.
source_quote: the controller shall, in order to ascertain whether processing for another purpose is compatible with the purpose for which the personal data are initially collected, take into account

claim_text: The controller must be able to demonstrate that a data subject has consented to processing of his or her personal data.
source_quote: Where processing is based on consent, the controller shall be able to demonstrate that the data subject has consented to processing of his or her personal data.

claim_text: Consent requests must be presented in a manner clearly distinguishable from other matters, in an intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language.
source_quote: If the data subject's consent is given in the context of a written declaration which also concerns other matters, the request for consent shall be presented in a manner which is clearly distinguishable from the other matters, in an intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language.

claim_text: Data subjects have the right to withdraw their consent at any time.
source_quote: The data subject shall have the right to withdraw his or her consent at any time.

claim_text: Withdrawal of consent does not affect the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal.
source_quote: The withdrawal of consent shall not affect the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal.

claim_text: Data subjects must be informed prior to giving their consent.
source_quote: Prior to giving consent, the data subject shall be informed thereof.

claim_text: It is as easy to withdraw consent as it is to give consent.
source_quote: It shall be as easy to withdraw as to give consent.

claim_text: Prior to giving consent, the data subject shall be informed thereof.
source_quote: Prior to giving consent, the data subject shall be informed thereof.

claim_text: It shall be as easy to withdraw as to give consent.
source_quote: It shall be as easy to withdraw as to give consent.

claim_text: The performance of a contract, including the provision of a service, is conditional on consent to the processing of personal data that is not necessary for the performance of that contract.
source_quote: whether, inter alia, the performance of a contract, including the provision of a service, is conditional on consent to the processing of personal data that is not necessary for the performance of that contract.

claim_text: The processing of the personal data of a child shall be lawful where the child is at least 16 years old.
source_quote: Where point (a) of Article 6(1) applies, in relation to the offer of information society services directly to a child, the processing of the personal data of a child shall be lawful where the child is at least 16 years old.

claim_text: The processing of the personal data of a child shall be lawful only if and to the extent that consent is given or authorised by the holder of parental responsibility over the child.
source_quote: Where the child is below the age of 16 years, such processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that consent is given or authorised by the holder of parental responsibility over the child.

claim_text: Member States may provide by law for a lower age for those purposes provided that such lower age is not below 13 years.
source_quote: Member States may provide by law for a lower age for those purposes provided that such lower age is not below 13 years.

claim_text: The controller shall make reasonable efforts to verify in such cases that consent is given or authorised by the holder of parental responsibility over the child.
source_quote: 2. The controller shall make reasonable efforts to verify in such cases that consent is given or authorised by the holder of parental responsibility over the child, taking into consideration available technology.
